data.title: Merge SpiceBloom RespawnDelay & GrowthDelay into Lifetime
data.body:
`RespawnDelay` is redundant (increasing the `spicebloom.spawnpoint`'s lifetime has basically the same effect) and allows us to scrap a `DelayedAction` and simplify the `SpiceBloom` code a little.

Additionally, this adds a new `KillsSelfAfterDelay` trait that allows us to ditch the `SpiceBloom` trait from the spicebloom.spawnpoint and might come in handy for other things in the future.

Contributes to #12310.

data.title: Serverinfo ingame
data.body:
would be nice if i could look up the name of the server that im playing on, ingame ... in case i have forgotten ... i'd say the score-screen (esc) would be a good place for that (right under the map name)

![here](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9139965/20023045/b72d21e6-a2dd-11e6-95d5-dec403772f57.png)

data.title: Fixed the 120mm bullet not harming infantry
data.body: Closes #12335.

data.title: Remove DelayedAction from WeaponInfo
data.body: Remove DelayedAction from WeaponInfo and replace it with the more serialization friendly DelayedImpact. This should be part of the fix for #12310.

data.title: Comm and Advanced Comm Center detect stealth when low power
data.body:
In TD the  the Communication Center and Advanced Communication Center still detect stealth when the player is in low power.
I assume this isnt intended

data.title: Fix the AmbientSound still playing when the actor is not in world
data.body:
Also fixes the origin of the sound not being updated for moving actors.
Imho we should really remove the "hack" when interval is zero. It's just a mess, sounds awful and blocks expanding the features of that trait. You could also use the length of the sound track as interval anyways.

data.title: Make Radar Dome lose Detect Cloak ability when powered down
data.body:
Fixes #12272 

I gave Radar Domes an upgrade "powered" that is revoked when the building is powered down. The linter is complaining because it thinks there's nothing granting the upgrade, which is true. However, it is enabled by default and is disabled by revoking the upgrade.

data.title: Range isn't restricted to weapon range of garrisoned unit in garrisoned defences
data.body:
In relation to the forum thread [The Elephant in the room](http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=19825&postdays=0&postorder=asc&start=0&sid=8a6d3d41a6b86bdb3498a6dd98e59423) regarding the current state of Allied and Soviet defence structures, I was trying to reduce the range of the pillbox as I think it could be a possible fix to the issue.

Currently pillboxes have an attack range of [6c0](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/618cd91cc7d4442d35ec5ea58a1012db732428a4/mods/ra/rules/structures.yaml#L564-L565) while [Flame Towers](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/618cd91cc7d4442d35ec5ea58a1012db732428a4/mods/ra/rules/structures.yaml#L661) have the weapon [FireballLauncher](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/c62870cc30765d2dca261c7f8fad246a3ee64ade/mods/ra/weapons/other.yaml#L1) with a range of [5c0](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/c62870cc30765d2dca261c7f8fad246a3ee64ade/mods/ra/weapons/other.yaml#L4), having spoken with @Phrohdoh on IRC I have been lead to believe that the pillbox and camopill attack range should be restricted to the range of the weapon of the garrisoned unit, the default being the [Vulcan](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/634faa31deb9e03ed7b49b06c9b6ade0225bcb01/mods/ts/weapons/smallguns.yaml#L47) weapon of [e1 infantry](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/dba5c2b4328c1bad883b965b1fa291bb995bf872/mods/ra/rules/infantry.yaml#L49), which has a range of [4c0](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/634faa31deb9e03ed7b49b06c9b6ade0225bcb01/mods/ts/weapons/smallguns.yaml#L49), the same as the default [M1Carbine](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/634faa31deb9e03ed7b49b06c9b6ade0225bcb01/mods/ts/weapons/smallguns.yaml#L24) of e1 infantry, however, this doesn't seem to be the case, as you can see in the screenshot below, the pillbox garrisoned by an e1 can fire to the full vision range of the pillbox (6c0), while the infantry next to it are force-firing at full range.

![M1Carbine vs Vulcan](http://oi67.tinypic.com/ckkci.jpg)

<details>
<summary>Click to expand IRC log</summary>

```
[03:49] <AMHOL> Hi all
[03:49] <AMHOL> Does anyone know whether a pillbox gets the range of the unit garrisoned in it?
[03:50] <AMHOL> Been playing games with pillbox spam testing out http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=19825&postdays=0&postorder=asc&start=0&sid=8a6d3d41a6b86bdb3498a6dd98e59423
[03:50] <@orabot> Title: Sleipnir's Stuff :: View topic - The Elephant in the room
[03:50] <AMHOL> I wanna try a map where a pillbox has the same range as the flame tower, I think it could fix the problem
[03:51] <AMHOL> As you won't really be able to micro them as they will only be able to hit the first line of infantry in a concave
[03:51] <AMHOL> But I only see FallbackRange in the YAML https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/618cd91cc7d4442d35ec5ea58a1012db732428a4/mods/ra/rules/structures.yaml#L564-L565
[03:51] <@orabot> Title: OpenRA/structures.yaml at 618cd91cc7d4442d35ec5ea58a1012db732428a4 · OpenRA/OpenRA · GitHub
[03:51] <+Phrohdoh> The pbox just uses the armament named 'garrisoned' when there is a unit in it.
[03:51] <AMHOL> Which I took to be an indication that it takes on the range of the garrisoned unit
[03:52] <AMHOL> So 'garrisoned' has a range?
[03:53] <+Phrohdoh> Oh I see what you mean.
[03:53] <+Phrohdoh> It uses the armament named garrisoned on the garrisoned actor type
[03:53] <+Phrohdoh> so if e3 has a 'garrisoned' armament it would use that range, I believe
[03:54] <AMHOL> Ahh OK
[03:54] <AMHOL> So perhaps a vision reduction could work instead
[03:54] <AMHOL> Hmm, maybe not actually
[03:54] <AMHOL> As they will probably have support with them
[03:55] <AMHOL> I guess e3 aren't so bad because their vision range is less than their attack range
[03:55] <AMHOL> Would there be a way to change the range with YAML alone?
[03:56] <+Phrohdoh> Change the range of the garrisoned armament on e3 or whatever actor.
[03:56] <+Phrohdoh> Or, if this is a thing:
[03:57] <+Phrohdoh> No, in fact ^ is the right answer
[03:57] <+Phrohdoh> AMHOL: Or are you talking about reveal range now?
[03:57] <AMHOL> No sorry
[03:57] <AMHOL> That was me thinking out loud lol
[03:57] <AMHOL> I think the attack range change is necessary
[03:59] <AMHOL> So I'd have to change the range of the "Vulcan" I guess
[04:00] <AMHOL> Hmm, Vulcan says it has 4c0
[04:00] <AMHOL> Pretty sure a pillbox can fire up to 6c0
[04:06] <+Phrohdoh> AttackBase.IsReachableTarget should prevent targeting beyond max range defined on the chosen armament.
[04:07] <+Phrohdoh> Going to call it quits for tonight. Goodnight all.
[04:07] == Phrohdoh [4cba4ea0@gateway/web/cgi-irc/kiwiirc.com/ip.76.186.78.160] has quit [Quit: http://www.kiwiirc.com/ - A hand crafted IRC client]
```
</details>

data.title: Remove hardcoded buildComplete delay in some overlays
data.body:
There certainly was and possibly still is some issue this was trying to work around, but unless it's a deal-breaker, we should rather try to fix that issue directly instead of keeping some uncommented magical work-around.

I couldn't spot any regressions in a D2k skirmish, all 3 overlays worked as intended there.

Contributes to #12310.

data.title: idea:replace yaml to xml format
data.body:
mod rules folder
ai.yaml to ai.xml

data.title: Fixed Mechanic and Medic can heal enemy units
data.body: Fixes #12336.

data.title: Add footprint support to Explodes, remove WithBuildingExplosion
data.body:
Using `Explodes` instead of `WithBuildingExplosion` allows us to spawn smudges under buildings when they explode and use warhead delay instead of WBE's (now removed) `Delay`.
While weapons/warheads currently use `DelayedAction` themselves, this will be fixed at some point, making a direct fix for `WithBuildingExplosion` obsolete.

I'm not sure whether `WithBuildingExplosion` should be killed off entirely at this point, though, as it's now harmless, a bit easier to use, and keeping it would maintain backwards-compatibility. Possibly a candidate for #12188.

Closes #4197.

Contributes a little to #12310.

data.title: Make friendly units aware of friendly mines
data.body:
In release-20161019, in RA, friendly units don't mind going over mines placed by friendly minelayers.
This change allows friendly units to route around friendly mines, while still going over invisible enemy mines and blowing up.

data.title: Medics & Mechanics can heal enemy soldiers and vehicles. [RA]
data.body:
This can be fixed by adding "ValidStances: Ally" to the Medic & Mechanic's Warhead.

OpenRA\mods\ra\weapons\other.yaml
Heal:
+Warhead@1Dam: SpreadDamage
++**ValidStances: Ally**

Repair:
+Warhead@1Dam: SpreadDamage
++**ValidStances: Ally**

data.title: The 120mm cannon is unable to harm infantry. [RA]
data.body:
If you force fire the ground with the Mammoth tank, then walk infantry into the shots, they won't be harmed.
"Infantry" should be removed from Warhead's "InvalidTargets:" list.

120mm:
+Warhead@1Dam: SpreadDamage
++InvalidTargets: Air, **Infantry**

data.title: Added distinction between RA minelayers
data.body: Changed tooltip for allied and soviet minelayer, making clear which one lays anti-personnel or anti-tank mines. In "release-20161019", two minelayers look the same in the menu, which creates problems if you capture a factory from opposing faction.

data.title: Prevent attacking units from knowing that a frozen building is dead
data.body: Prevent units attacking a frozen building from magically knowing whether it is destroyed or not. (Note: I'm aware that this patch is not perfect yet. If you will tell me what else needs to be fixed, I will fix it).

data.title: Changed the Author of 'Nine Lives' to PizzaAtomica
data.body: Closes #12328.

data.title: Fixed tiling error on the map 'Behind the Veil'
data.body:
Fixes #12326.

![openra-2016-11-01t113804619z](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/21260178/19888742/e9989a7a-a030-11e6-8129-782ef73a2747.png)

data.title: Aircraft reveals shroud/fog based on animation, not actual position.
data.body:
Actual position meaning the cell the aircraft hovers above. It's a balance issue really. Aircrafts approaching from the south has a significant advantage due to being able to fire and being fired upon from the occupied cell. This concerns all mods.

Left vs Right, no difference.
![gap1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/19876250/9d66974e-9fd4-11e6-939a-ef30dfecbdf0.jpg)

Top vs Bottom, big difference.
![gap2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/19876260/bf42772a-9fd4-11e6-9455-cffcf6677bb8.jpg)

AA Gun targeting range edging the Longbow's cell position (shadow).
![gap3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/19876270/d6f2ac1e-9fd4-11e6-964e-e2345144a52b.jpg)

Longbows' missile range based upon cell position.
![gap4](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/19876292/fe3024fa-9fd4-11e6-9e88-b2fdaee834f9.jpg)

This discrepancy plays out in all air to ground engagements giving the south position a significant advantage of about 2-4 cells (due to variable shroud rendering) in vision/targetting involving helicopters and even more so with YAK/MiGs which has an higher altitude - giving the south position a staggering 4-6 cells advantage.

This issue has probably gone unnoticed because of the shroud reveal visually looks logical from the placement of the animated aircraft.

data.title: System.IndexOutOfRangeException on map: "Orion"
data.body:
followup from #12306

i have managed to reproduce this by my myself ... creating a server and joining with a 2nd client ... when i surrender with the 2nd client (1v1) the game will crash for both 

when i surrrender and there is more players (bots) in the game (ffa) ... then just the surrendered client will crash the others stay in the game ...

data.title: Author of the map Nine Lives
data.body: Author of the map Nine Lives is shown as "Anonymous".

data.title: The Radar Jammer can no longer defend other units.
data.body:
In the previous release, you could use the defend command ("d") to make Radar Jammers follow your units around keeping them safe. This made them a lot easier to use.

This is probably caused by [#11637](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/11637)  -- where units without weapons no longer have combat related abilities (attack move & defend).

Also related to [#12201](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/12201)

data.title: Missing road tile on Behind The Veil.
data.body:
There's missing a road tile on the map Behind The Veil.

![behindtheveil1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14160257/19856710/f43d4f18-9f7a-11e6-94a5-ecd1b3750d54.jpg)

data.title: Global chat name is reset when connecting
data.body: Repro case: Change the username in the field and then connect.  You are immediately renamed to your original name once connected.

data.title: Nudged actors display a move-flash at their current location
data.body: Repro case: try placing a wall segment on top of an infantry unit.

data.title: Fix dedicated server crash with AllowPortForward.
data.body:
UPnP is provided as a convenience for players who want to spin up a temporary server ingame.  We don't (and have no intention to) support it for dedicated servers, and will crash if someone tries to launch a dedicated server with `AllowPortForward=true` (because the UPnP state has not been initialized).

This fixes #12263 by force-disabling the UPnP calls on dedicated servers.

data.title: Added allies-06a to the Red Alert mod
DirectX renderer
data.body:
I guess there is more than one solution to this, e.g.:
- indirectly with OpenGL ES through ANGLE
- through some kind of framework like @MonoGame
- natively with MDX or @SharpDX

Note: Just opening this ticket as it is an often requested feature. I don't plan to work on this myself.
